p: Recently, the disclosure of ZIKV silent spread has underscored its latent threat to public health ( Grubaugh et al., 2019). Considering there are still no approved vaccines, the development of specific drugs for ZIKV infection is paramount. The promising results observed in our present study suggest that ZY13, a representative analog of snake cathelicidin BF-30, is a promising molecule against ZIKV infection (summarized in Figure 6). Furthermore, our study also highlights the importance of venom peptides as prototypes for antivirals development.
